definition: plate/dish/tray/board/hard drive (computing)/to build/to coil/to check/to examine/to transfer (property)/to make over/classifier for food: dish, helping/to coil/classifier for coils of wire/classifier for games of chess

sentences.english: It is permanent or nonvolatile storage, such as the data stored on diskettes.
sentences.chinese: 它是永久或非易失性存儲，如軟盤上存儲的數據。

sentences.english: Can not save to a network drive or a floppy disk.
sentences.chinese: 無法將它們玻存到一滾硒媽驅動器或踊個軟盤。

sentences.english: Do you keep your e-dictionary on the hard disk or a floppy disk?
sentences.chinese: 你把你的電子詞典保存在硬盤上還是軟盤上？

sentences.english: Creative laptop bag made out of 42 recycled floppy disks.
sentences.chinese: 用42張回收軟盤做成的創意筆記本電腦包。

sentences.english: And now you truly can see that there's not much to this disk.
sentences.chinese: 你將會發現這個軟盤組件並不多。

sentences.english: Simply boot using a different media, such as floppies.
sentences.chinese: 只需要使用不同的媒介引導，比如軟盤。

sentences.english: Select Text-Mode and you are saying "Bye Bye, Floppy".
sentences.chinese: 選擇文本模式和你說“再見，軟盤”。

sentences.english: Will you help me pick up the disk?
sentences.chinese: 幫我把軟盤拾起來好嗎？

sentences.english: The specified disk or diskette cannot be accessed.
sentences.chinese: 無法訪問指定的磁盤或軟盤。

sentences.english: Of course, you can always make copies of your hard-disk files on floppy disks.
sentences.chinese: 當然，你可以將硬盤上的文件拷貝到軟盤上。

sentences.english: A good choice is to create a copy of this file onto a diskette or other removeable media.
sentences.chinese: 最好是把私鑰文件備份到軟盤或光盤中。

sentences.english: Sony's sales of floppies worldwide ended in March of this year.
sentences.chinese: 索尼公司在今年三月份在全球其它地方停售軟盤。

sentences.english: Most worldwide manufacturers of floppies already put thekibosh on the little
sentences.chinese: 全球大部分軟盤製造商已經停產。
這些軟盤通常稱爲“啓動軟盤”。
這些軟盤通常稱爲“啓動軟盤”。

sentences.english: This file is copied onto the virtual floppy disk.
sentences.chinese: 將這個文件複製到虛擬軟盤中。

definition: not recognizing one's family (idiom); self-centered and not making any allowances for the needs of one's relatives
to open fire/to shoot a gun
scholars tend to disparage one another (idiom)

lit. to assess the head and discuss the feet (idiom); minute criticism of a woman's appearance/fig. to find fault in minor details/to remark upon a person's appearance/nitpicking/overcritical/judgmental
